name.description: The full name of this agent.

alternate.description: A list of alternate names for this agent.

firstname.description: The first (or given) name of this agent.

middlename.description: The middle name of this agent.

lastname.description: The last (or family) name of this agent.

bibliographicCitation.description: A bibliographic reference for the resource. Recommended practice is to include sufficient bibliographic detail to identify the resource as unambiguously as possible (from http://purl.org/dc/terms/bibliographicCitation).

type.description: The type of publication. BibTeX entry types (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/BibTeX#Entry_types) are recommended.

series_editors.description: The editors of the series of work of which this work is a part.

city.description: The city in which this work was published.

figure.description: The figure(s) in the work being cited.

taxonomic_unit.description: A unit of taxonomy, i.e. a taxon, taxon concept or specimen.

@type.description: The type of this taxonomic unit.

hasName.description: The scientific name of this taxon, taxon concept or specimen.

@type.description: The type of this taxonomic name.

nomenclaturalCode.description: The nomenclatural code under which this name is defined.

description: A Phyx file contains digital clade definitions and optionally phylogenies that indicate where they should resolve. See http://phyloref.org/phyx.js for more information.

@context.description: Every Phyx file should have a @context, making it a valid JSON-LD file.

citation.description: A citation to the source of this Phyx file.

defaultNomenclaturalCodeIRI.description: The default nomenclatural code to use for new phyloreferences in this Phyx file.

@type.description: Addition RDF types for the top-level object. `owl:Ontology` is added automatically.

owl:imports.description: A list of additional OWL imports to be added in this ontology.

phylogenies.description: A phylogeny is an evolutionary hypothesis that can be used to test Phyx files.

newick.description: This phylogeny represented as a Newick string (https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Newick_format).

phylogenyType.description: Specifies what type of phylogeny this is. All phylogenies are assumed to be 'phylogeny', unless they are a 'reference_phylogeny' or a 'primary_reference_phylogeny'.

source.description: A citation to the published source of this phylogeny.

regnumId.description: The identifier of this clade definition in the Regnum database

label.description: The name or label of this phyloreference.

scientificNameAuthorship.description: The authors of the scientific name being used as the phyloreference label (if any)

namePublishedIn.description: The source of the scientific name being used as the phyloreference label (if any)

definition.description: A verbatim, free-text definition of this clade.

definitionSource.description: The source of the clade definition.

internalSpecifiers.description: An array of taxonomic units that must be included in the defined clade

externalSpecifiers.description: An array of taxonomic units that must be excluded from the defined clade

apomorphy.description: For a phyloreference using an apomorphy, this field describes the phenotype (or trait) being used as the apomorphy

definition.description: A natural language description of this apomorphy.

phenotypicQuality.description: The quality of this phenotype. Must be a subclass of pato:quality.

phenotypeBearer.description: The phenotype being used as an apomorphy.
